alert.note: Alert for Foothills of the Blue Mountains of Washington; Kittitas Valley; Lower Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Northwest Blue Mountains; Simcoe Highlands; Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest; Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 29 at 3:13PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISES ON STREAMS AND RIVERS WILL CONTINUE DUE TO SNOWMELT... Streams and rivers emanating from the mountains will continue to see rises into the middle of next week. High pressure building over the Pacific Northwest has led to an increase in temperatures, though a brief cooling period is expected to take place over the weekend, with more warming expected middle of next week. Given above normal snowpack currently in place over the mountains, accelerating snowmelt will continue to lead to rises in streams and rivers with several gauges forecasted to get close to or meet bankfull over the weekend into early next week. The Naches at Naches and Cliffdell, and the John Day at Service Creek have already risen above bankfull but are not expected to reach minor flood stage until next weekend. A few gauges may briefly cross into minor flood stage next week, but widespread flooding is currently not anticipated. This Hydrologic Outlook will be updated again Monday afternoon with any pertinent updates concerning the latest flood forecast.
